definitions: person or organization acting as link between parties in negotiation or transaction
position or state existing between two points or extremes
examples: The bank served as intermediary between buyer and seller
She hired an intermediary to handle the delicate contract negotiations
This course serves as an intermediary between basic and advanced levels
The committee occupies an intermediary role in the governance structure

definitions: learner who has progressed beyond beginner but not reached advanced level
stage or level occurring between two extremes or endpoints
examples: The intermediate students practice conversation twice weekly
Language schools often struggle to keep intermediates engaged and progressing
We need an intermediate solution between these two extremes
The intermediate phase of construction will take six months

definitions: formal act or ceremony of burying a dead person
examples: The interment took place at the family cemetery
Private interment followed the public memorial service yesterday

definitions: short piece of music performed between acts of opera or play
brief intervening period or episode between main events
examples: The orchestra performed a delightful intermezzo before the final act
Brahms composed several famous intermezzos for solo piano
Their summer romance was merely an intermezzo in both their lives
The peaceful years served as an intermezzo between two wars

definitions: pause or break between parts of a theatrical or musical performance
examples: Refreshments are served during the twenty-minute intermission
The play runs three hours including one intermission

definitions: student or recent graduate working temporarily to gain practical experience
junior doctor receiving supervised training in a hospital
examples: The company hires fifty interns every summer
She worked as an unpaid intern at the magazine
The medical intern worked thirty-six hour shifts
First-year interns rotate through different hospital departments

definitions: process of making attitudes, behaviors, or beliefs part of one's nature through learning or unconscious assimilation
incorporation of external costs or functions into an organization's internal operations
examples: The internalization of social norms begins in early childhood
Therapy helped her recognize the internalization of negative messages
The company's internalization of shipping saved millions annually
Market internalization of environmental costs could reduce pollution

definitions: political principle advocating greater cooperation among nations and peoples
examples: His internationalism contrasted sharply with growing nationalist sentiments
The organization promotes internationalism through cultural exchange programs

definitions: person who advocates or supports internationalism and cooperation between nations
examples: The internationalists argued for stronger United Nations involvement
She was a committed internationalist who spoke five languages

definitions: worldwide system of interconnected computer networks using standardized communication protocols
examples: The internet revolutionized how people communicate and access information
Rural areas still lack reliable internet connectivity

definitions: physician specializing in diagnosis and medical treatment of adults' internal organ disorders
examples: Her internist referred her to a cardiologist
The internist diagnosed the rare autoimmune condition

definitions: imprisonment or confinement of people, commonly in large groups, without trial
examples: The internment of Japanese Americans remains a dark chapter
Political internment violated basic human rights

definitions: temporary position providing practical experience in an occupation or profession
examples: She secured a prestigious internship at the investment bank
Medical school requires completing a one-year internship

definitions: ability of different systems, devices, or organizations to work together and exchange information effectively
examples: Software interoperability ensures seamless data sharing between platforms
Military interoperability allows allied forces to coordinate operations

definitions: way in which two or more things have reciprocal effects on each other
examples: The interplay between genetics and environment shapes personality
The film explores the interplay of light and shadow

definitions: insertion of something different into a text or conversation
estimation of unknown values between two known values in a sequence
examples: The manuscript contains several later interpolations by scribes
His constant interpolations disrupted the speaker's presentation
Linear interpolation helps estimate missing data points
The software uses interpolation to smooth the animation

definitions: explanation or way of explaining the meaning of something
particular way of performing or presenting an artistic work
examples: Her interpretation of the data challenged conventional wisdom
Legal interpretation of the statute remains controversial
The pianist's interpretation of Chopin was deeply personal
Each director brings their own interpretation to Shakespeare

definitions: person who translates spoken words from one language to another
computer program that directly executes instructions without compilation
examples: The court provided an interpreter for the witness
She works as a sign language interpreter
Python uses an interpreter rather than a compiler
The JavaScript interpreter processes code line by line

definitions: professional activity of translating spoken language in real time
examples: Conference interpreting requires exceptional concentration skills
She studied interpreting at the specialized institute

definitions: period when normal government is suspended, especially between successive reigns or regimes
examples: The interregnum lasted three years before the new king
A constitutional interregnum followed the revolution

definitions: formal and systematic questioning, especially by police or military personnel
examples: The suspect underwent twelve hours of interrogation
Video recordings showed the interrogation techniques used

definitions: word used to form questions, such as who, what, when, where
examples: English interrogatives include who, what, where, and when
The interrogative pronoun begins the sentence

definitions: person who questions someone closely, aggressively, or formally
examples: The skilled interrogator extracted crucial information
Military interrogators received specialized training

definitions: signal causing a computer to temporarily stop current processing
examples: The hardware interrupt signaled incoming data
Software interrupts handle system calls efficiently

definitions: instance of stopping or breaking the continuity of an activity or process
act of breaking into someone's speech or conversation
examples: Power interruptions damaged the computer equipment
The construction caused numerous interruptions to our work
His constant interruptions made the meeting run overtime
She apologized for the interruption and continued speaking

definitions: place where two or more roads meet and cross each other
set containing elements common to two or more given sets
examples: The accident occurred at a busy intersection downtown
Traffic lights control the major intersection
The intersection of art and technology creates new possibilities
Find the intersection of these two data sets

definitions: person born with physical sex characteristics that don't fit typical binary notions of male or female bodies
examples: Intersex individuals may have variations in chromosomes or hormones
Medical understanding of intersex conditions has evolved significantly

definitions: major highway that connects different states in the United States
examples: They drove along Interstate 95 to reach Florida
The interstate system revolutionized American transportation

definitions: period of time between two events or points
difference in pitch between two musical notes
set of real numbers between two given numbers
examples: Check the oil at regular intervals
There was a long interval between meetings
The interval between C and G is a perfect fifth
She practiced singing intervals to improve pitch
The confidence interval indicates statistical reliability
Values fall within the specified interval

definitions: action taken to improve a situation or prevent it from getting worse
organized confrontation with someone about their addiction or destructive behavior
examples: Military intervention prevented humanitarian disaster
Early intervention improves outcomes for autistic children
The family staged an intervention about his drinking
Professional intervention specialists guided the process

definitions: formal meeting for assessing qualifications of a job applicant
conversation where questions are asked to obtain information for publication
examples: She prepared thoroughly for the job interview
The interview panel consisted of three managers
The celebrity gave an exclusive interview to the magazine
The journalist conducted interviews with several witnesses

definitions: person who is being interviewed for a job or for information
examples: The interviewee arrived fifteen minutes early
All interviewees received the same standard questions

definitions: person who conducts an interview, especially for employment or media
examples: The interviewer asked challenging technical questions
Experienced interviewers can spot dishonest answers

definitions: long tube-like organ in the digestive system where nutrients are absorbed
examples: The small intestine absorbs most nutrients from food
Intestinal bacteria play crucial roles in digestion

definitions: Palestinian uprising against Israeli occupation, particularly those beginning in 1987 and 2000
examples: The first intifada began with civil disobedience
The second intifada saw increased violence and casualties

definitions: close familiarity or friendship characterized by affection and understanding
physical or emotional closeness associated with love and sexuality
examples: Their long friendship developed deep emotional intimacy
The small venue created intimacy between performers and audience
The couple struggled with intimacy after the betrayal
Physical intimacy requires trust and communication

definitions: person with whom one has a particularly close relationship
examples: Only her most intimate friends knew the truth
He counted her among his few intimates

definitions: action of frightening or threatening someone to make them do what you want
examples: Voter intimidation undermines democratic processes
The witness refused to testify due to intimidation

definitions: unwillingness to accept views, beliefs, or behaviors different from one's own
inability to consume or be exposed to a substance without adverse effects
examples: Religious intolerance led to widespread persecution
The rise of intolerance threatens social cohesion
Lactose intolerance affects millions of people worldwide
Food intolerance differs from allergic reactions

definitions: rise and fall of the voice in speaking, especially affecting meaning or emotion
examples: English uses intonation to distinguish questions from statements
Her sarcastic intonation contradicted her polite words

definitions: state of being drunk or under the influence of drugs
state of great excitement or exhilaration
examples: Public intoxication resulted in his arrest
The level of intoxication was measured by blood tests
The intoxication of early success clouded his judgment
She felt intoxication from the mountain air

definitions: private computer network within an organization using internet protocols
examples: Employees access company resources through the corporate intranet
The intranet hosts internal documentation and tools

definitions: refusal to change one's views or to agree about something
examples: Political intransigence prevented any meaningful compromise
His intransigence on the issue frustrated negotiations

definitions: verb that does not take a direct object
examples: The verb 'sleep' is intransitive in English
Intransitive verbs cannot be used in passive voice

definitions: secret planning of something illicit or detrimental
quality of arousing curiosity or interest through being unusual or mysterious
examples: Political intrigue surrounded the sudden resignation
The novel weaves a complex web of intrigue
The archaeological discovery held great intrigue for scientists
Her air of intrigue attracted many admirers

definitions: opening section of a piece of music or performance
examples: The song's intro features a memorable guitar riff
Skip the intro and get to the main content

definitions: action of introducing something or someone for the first time
preliminary section of a book or speech explaining its purpose
formal presentation of one person to another
examples: The introduction of new technology revolutionized the industry
This course provides an introduction to quantum physics
The book's introduction explains the author's methodology
She wrote a compelling introduction to the report
After brief introductions, the meeting began
The host made the formal introductions at dinner

definitions: examination of one's own thoughts, feelings, and mental processes
examples: Through introspection, she understood her motivations better
The retreat encouraged deep introspection and meditation

definitions: person who tends to turn inward mentally and prefers solitary activities
examples: As an introvert, she needed quiet time to recharge
Introverts often excel at deep, focused work

definitions: person who enters a place without permission, especially with criminal intent
examples: Security cameras detected an intruder on the property
The intruder fled when the alarm sounded
